cards.front: What are Newton's laws of motion?
cards.back: 1) An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force. 2) The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass. 3) For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: What is the third law of Newton's laws of motion, also known as the action-reaction principle?
options: A) Every action creates an equal and opposite reaction immediately.
B) The sum of the internal forces on a closed system is zero.
C) An object in motion will remain in motion unless acted upon by an external force.
D) For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction, but not necessarily at the same time.
questions.rationale: This statement accurately describes the third law of Newton's laws of motion.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's first law (law of inertia) states that an object at rest tends to stay at rest, and an object in motion tends to stay in motion, unless acted upon by a net force; Newton's second law (F=ma) relates the acceleration of an object to its mass and the applied force; Newton's third law (action-reaction principle) states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction
